thread.title: 1st Test: West Indies lose openers in chase of Sri Lanka's 484
thread.title_full: 1st Test: West Indies lose openers in chase of Sri Lanka's 484

title: 1st Test: West Indies lose openers in chase of Sri Lanka's 484
text:
Cricket 1st Test: West Indies lose openers in chase of Sri Lanka's 484 
West Indies lost its openers early after Sri Lanka posted a mammoth 484 all out in its first innings of the first Test on Thursday. AP | Galle, October 15, 2015 | UPDATED 18:43 IST Mail A+ A- 
West Indies lost its openers early after Sri Lanka posted a mammoth 484 all out in its first innings of the first Test on Thursday. 
The tourists were 66-2 at stumps on day two in Galle, still trailing by 418 runs. Left-arm spinner Rangana Herath removed both West Indies openers to give Sri Lanka complete control of the game. 
Earlier, after being 425-3, Sri Lanka's innings collapsed as they lost their last seven wickets for 59 runs with leg-spinner Devendra Bishoo claiming four. 
Opener Dimuth Karunaratne (186) and middle order batsman Dinesh Chandimal (151) were the mainstay of the Sri Lanka innings while captain Angelo Mathews chipped in with 48.
